Alternatively, maybe the fact that Buddhists are different from others could mean they're more open to diverse interactions, including local vendors. But I'm not sure if that's directly related to their interest in business.

Buddhist people, while different from others, are still religious individuals who engage in prayer and other religious practices. Their openness to community interaction could mean they're more willing to engage with local vendors, especially if those vendors share their values or practices.
